p: To establish the age window when synaptic genes showed TTTPs, we used a bootstrapping approach to test whether synaptic genes have higher ALiGeT scores in particular years in the Braincloud dataset. Each year between 22 and 33 years of age showed a significant increase in synapse-associated ALiGeT scores and we refer to this as the ALiGeT hPSD window. A replication study (Somel) using a smaller human transcriptome dataset ( Somel et al., 2009) gave an overlapping estimate for the synaptic ALiGeT hPSD window at 17–22 years ( Figure 4c). We next applied the DeGeT method and found all five consecutive age sets from 24 to 36 years were significantly enriched in hPSD genes ( Figure 4d). This result was confirmed in two independent human frontal cortex datasets ( Somel et al., 2009; Kang et al., 2011) (see Figure 4—figure supplement 1). Similarly, we identified the ALiGeT mPSD window in mice at 126 to 151 days ( Figure 4e). These data show that transcripts encoding postsynaptic proteins were significantly enriched in TTTPs during early adulthood in all four datasets tested, spanning two species and two brain regions.
